location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'Map showing TRIBES AND NEW BOUNDARY OF THE ADEN PROTECTORATE'

physicalDescription.extent: Materials: Printed on paper.Dimensions: 408 x 494mm, on sheet 532 x 605mm.

mods.abstract: The map shows parts of southern Yemen, including the Aden Protectorate. The map, which was produced by the War Office, includes lines drawn both in red ink and in yellow and blue crayon. According to notes written in pencil, the blue line depicts the '[r]ough boundary of Imam's [Yaḥyá Muḥammad Ḥamīd al-Dīn's] present encroachments', the yellow line shows the Imam's proposed boundary, and the red line illustrates the boundary proposed by the Assistant Political Resident at Aden, Major Trenchard Craven William Fowle.
